span.style: font-size:18; font-family:Comic Sans MS; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#550000
font-size:14; font-family:微软雅黑; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#000000

item.answer:
【考法 1】 v. 因为怀疑、恐惧而犹豫： to hesitate because of doubt, fear, or scruples
【例】 boggle at the dilemma [dɪ'lemə]
【近】 hesitate['hezɪteɪt], falter['fɔːltə], waver
【考法 2】 v. 笨拙地做： to make or do (something) in a clumsy or unskillful way
【例】 She boggled her first effort to make Christmas cookies.
【近】 botch, bungle.
